chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C Stahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence Credit for 175 days were granted.
AMENDED 3/9/2016:  COURT ORDERS THAT THE DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.
Concurrent with: any other sentence he is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha City Police Department.   Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment or school.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any drugs without a valid doctor's prescription and to be taken only as prescribed.

Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Driver's License.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the clerk amend the judgment of conviction to indicate Mr. Stahl is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Signed by Judge Ramirez on 3/9/16.

Defendant Steven C Stahl in court, in custody by telephone, with attorney Katie Ruth York.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the motion filed by Attorney York requesting the Defendant qualify for the Substance Abuse Program.  The State does not take a position on the motion.  The Court grants the request and finds the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the judgment of conviction is to be amended to reflect the change.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven C Stahl in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #2

Sentence of 

6 Years Imprisonment concurrent to any other sentence he is serving (Credit - 175 days)
3 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of any drugs without a valid doctors prescription and to be taken only as prescribed
Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment or school;
FINE:  $2527.00  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukeha Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel
From Jackson Correctional Institution.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-08-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant Steven C Stahl was to appear by video conference from Jackson Correctional Institution.  Attorney J Anthony Rosario in Court.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court could not get the video conference to connect properly due to technical difficulties.  Case set for a plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Check Case scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 12:00 am.
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.
